text: Too much of anything is bad, but too much good whiskey is barely enough.
author: Mark Twain

text: I wish to live to 150 years old, but the day I die, I wish it to be with a cigarette in one hand and a glass of whiskey in the other.
author: Ava Gardner

text: What whiskey will not cure, there is no cure for.
author: Irish proverb

text: There is no bad whiskey. There are only some whiskeys that aren't as good as others.
author: Raymond Chandler

text: It is true that whisky improves with age. The older I get, the more I like it.
author: Robert Black

text: Courage is a vitamin best swallowed with whiskey.
author: Jarod Kintz

text: When life hands you lemons, make whiskey sours.
author: W. C. Fields

text: When asked for his hangover cure, I take the juice of two bottles of whisky.
author: Dean Martin

text: While I can't walk on water, I can certainly wobble on whisky.
author: Ashwin Sanghi
